author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: َالخَوْفُ بِالأَمانِ وَالضَّعْفُ بِالقُدْرَةِ وَالذِّلَّةُ بِالعِزَّةِ، بِأَنْ تُؤَيِّدَنِي وَعِبادَكَ عَلَى إِعْلآءِ ذِكْرِكَ وَإِبْلاغِ كَلِمَتِكَ وَإِظْهارِ أَمْرِكَ بِحَيْثُ لا يَمْنَعُنا يا مَحْبُوبِي سَطْوَةُ الظَّالِمِينَ وَغَضَبُ المُشْرِكِينَ، أَيْ رَبِّ أَنَا أَمَتُكَ الَّتِيْ سَمِعْتُ نِدائَكَ وَسَرُعْتُ
translation: I beseech Thee, by Thy name through which Thou turnest restlessness into tranquility, fear into confidence, weakness into strength, and abasement into glory, that Thou of Thy grace wilt aid me and Thy servants to exalt Thy name, to deliver Thy Message, and to proclaim Thy Cause, in such wise that we may remain unmoved by either the assaults of the transgressors or the wrath of the infidels, O Thou Who art my Well-Beloved!
